title: 1988–89 Southern Football League
text:
The 1988–89 <a href="Southern%20Football%20League">Southern Football League</a> season was the 86th in the history of the league, an English <a href="Association%20football">football</a> competition.
<a href="Merthyr%20Tydfil%20F.C.">Merthyr Tydfil</a> won the Premier Division and earned promotion to the <a href="Football%20Conference">Football Conference</a>, whilst <a href="Coventry%20Sporting%20F.C.">Coventry Sporting</a>, <a href="Wellingborough%20Town%20F.C.">Wellingborough Town</a>, <a href="Mile%20Oak%20Rovers%20%26amp%3B%20Youth%20F.C.">Mile Oak Rovers</a>, <a href="Tonbridge%20Angels%20F.C.">Tonbridge</a> and <a href="Ruislip%20F.C.">Ruislip</a> left the league at the end of the season.
Premier Division.
The Premier Division consisted of 22 clubs, including 16 clubs from the <a href="1987%E2%80%9388%20Southern%20Football%20League%23Premier%20Division">previous season</a> and six new clubs:
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Midland Division.
The Midland Division consisted of 22 clubs, including 17 clubs from the <a href="1987%E2%80%9388%20Southern%20Football%20League%23Midland%20Division">previous season</a> and five new clubs:
Also, at the end of the season <a href="Forest%20Green%20Rovers%20F.C.">Forest Green Rovers</a> was renamed Stroud and Ashfield Hightree was renamed <a href="Sandwell%20Borough%20F.C.">Sandwell Borough</a>.
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Southern Division.
The Southern Division consisted of 22 clubs, including 18 clubs from the <a href="1987%E2%80%9388%20Southern%20Football%20League%23Southern%20Division">previous season</a> and four new clubs:
At the end of the season <a href="Margate%20F.C.">Thanet United</a> reverted name to Margate.
League table.
